item.description:
Please read the full description from top to bottom, before you RSVP Yes.

Hit two peaks with great views. Imp Face is on the 52 with a view list and North Carter has views from just below its summit and is on the Trailwrights and YMCA Alpine lists. Weather for Wednesday is looking good as is foliage. If time, energy, and spirit allow we may also visit Mt. Lethe which requires abouit a 100 yard bushwhack off trail. There are two possibilities for routes. One is a loop, but requires a car spot. The other is an out and back.


GPS coordinates: 44.323239, -71.216854
Map of 44.323239, -71.216854

Distance: 9.2-11.1 miles
Elevation gain: 3950-4400 ft
Book Time: 6 hours and 35 minutes to 7 hours and 45 minutes
Trails: Imp Trail (North Branch), North Carter Trail, Carter-Moriah Trail


Snow is present at the higher summits currently, as is temperatures cold enough to make it, so be prepared for it. The sun is setting earlier so bring a headlamp just in case. There is one larger brook crossing, so have water proof boots and changes of socks.



Please keep your rsvp's up to date. Its very important that we have a true headcount, and not worry that your late or lost.

Make sure your hiker profile is complete so we can verify that your qualified to join us on this White Mountain hike.

See What to wear on a hike and pack water and food.

Your response/signing up for a hike certifies that you have read, understand, and agree with the NEHAAG disclaimer.

Carpooling is always advised and a great way to get to know your fellow members.
item.name: Imp Face, North Carter, and more
